comments:
20020529 and 30 build
libswt-cde-motif-2041.sl and libswt-motif-2041.sl do not have execute 
permission set, I needed to change it manually after installing eclipse.


java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /bluebird/teamswt/kkolosow/eclipse0530ihp/plugin
s/org.eclipse.swt.motif_2.0.0/os/hpux/hp9000/libswt-motif-2041.sl: Permission 
denied
        at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(Unknown Source)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:102)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.motif.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:14)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.createDisplay(Display.java:506)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.create(Display.java:492)
        at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.<init>(Device.java:104)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:318)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:315)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1110)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:739)
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:200)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:643)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:476)

This is likely a side-effect of them being sent in a zip from rational. I talked 
to MV about it. He said that Eclipse doesn't deal with the file permissions 
but leaves them the same as whatever is initially set to, so you will need 
to SSH to the server (or use the command line client) to fix this.

The only time the execute bit of a local file can be set by the CVS client is 
when it is first added to CVS control and committed. After that the only way to 
set the bit is to log onto the server.
Fixed on the cvs server, so should take effect for the F2 build.
